name: Black Freedom in the Atlantic World
description: Black writers and historical actors were at the vanguard of re-conceiving, implementing, and realizing much of the Enlightenment project of freedom. Africans and people of African descent significantly affected its meaning in the Atlantic world. The course sets out to explore this history as well as the contemporary practice of freedom.
prerequisites: 1.0 FCE in African or European history, or permission of course instructor
